column3: So, this test isn't tight: there are a small number of signature values for which S doesn't have the high bit set (and so is shorter than the length limit) but is still greater than the order. These could still be mutated under this rule.\n\nIn discussion with Pieter, he pointed out that the probability of hitting one of these values was less than 1 in 2^127 and that this way avoids exposing the o
